intro: Dasystachys nervata, commonly known as the veined spurge or narrow-veined spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent veins, and it produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in arid regions.
